Student Computer Recommendations
UC Davis Student Resources – FAQ’s

The Computer Science (CS) Undergraduate Advising team provides major academic advising to currently matriculated UCD undergraduate students in Computer Science (CS) and Computer Science & Engineering (CSE).

CS Undergraduate Advisors partner with CS and CSE students to provide assistance on their academic journey. Our goal is to teach our students how to understand their academic requirements and navigate the university resources available to help them along the way.
Advising is a collaborative process that will require each student to play an active role.
Appointments are available to students declared in the CS and CSE majors only. If you are interested in changing majors, please visit our Change of Major webpage.
If you are a CS/CSE major, visit our Appointments webpage.
Drop-in hours are for declared CS and CSE majors only.
If you are interested in changing to one of our majors, please attend a Change of Major Info Session. You can view the upcoming dates and register on our Changing Majors webpage.
Drop-in hours are 10-15 minute sessions for quick questions, for example, Spring 2023 graduation checks or schedules checks.
To see a CS advisor during drop-ins, please join our Virtual Front Desk during our available drop-in hours.
Questions about GE and university requirements should be directed to your College Dean’s Office Advisors.  CSE majors: EUO Express Advising | CS majors: LSUEA Virtual Front Desk

Students interested in changing majors into CS/CSE or adding a double major in CS must attend a virtual advising session with the CS Advising Team. The advising sessions will cover the requirements to be eligible to change majors/double major and minor, frequently asked questions, and will provide time for students to ask questions to the advisors. Advising sessions are open to current UC Davis students only. You must be logged in to your UC Davis Zoom account to register.
